data:
Generate a story and a one short sentence as a title in the journalism style. For the story you generate put the title at the first row. The story should involves the following entities and summary. Please make sure the story you generate is at least 500 words long.
Summary: March 13 - RJ Barrett scored 13 of his 30 points in the fourth quarter and the New York Knicks stopped a three-game losing streak by holding on for a 112-108 victory over the host Los Angeles Lakers on Sunday night. Julius Randle led the Knicks with 33 points after shooting 5-of-24 in his previous game, but Barrett played the role of closer. Barrett's bucket made it 110-100 with 2:34 left, but it was New York's final basket, and the Knicks survived a dicey finish. After the Lakers called their final timeout, the game ended when D'Angelo Russell missed a 3-pointer with 1.3 seconds left. Russell made six 3-pointers and scored 33 points, but the Lakers saw their three-game winning streak stopped and they missed an opportunity to reach .500 for the first time this season. Darius Garland came back after a one-game absence and scored 28 points and Cleveland put together a strong fourth quarter to defeat host Charlotte. Joel Embiid had 34 points, eight rebounds, four assists and four blocked shots to lift Philadelphia past host Washington. Anfernee Simons scored 17 points and Shaedon Sharpe and Kevin Knox II added 14 each for Portland, which played without leading scorer Damian Lillard (32.1 ppg) because of right calf soreness.RJ Barrett scored 13 of his 30 points in the fourth quarter and the New York Knicks stopped a three-game losing streak by holding on for a 112-108 victory over the host Los Angeles Lakers on Sunday night. Julius Randle led the Knicks with 33 points after shooting 5-of-24 in his previous game, but Barrett played the role of closer. Barrett's bucket made it 110-100 with 2:34 left, but it was New York's final basket, and the Knicks survived a dicey finish. PHOTOS: Atlanta Hawks Fast Break 5K Russell made six 3-pointers and scored 33 points, but the Lakers saw their three-game winning streak stopped and they missed an opportunity to reach.500 for the first time this season. Cavaliers 114, Hornets 108 Darius Garland came back after a one-game absence and scored 28 points and Cleveland put together a strong fourth quarter to defeat host Charlotte. 76ers 112, Wizards 93 Joel Embiid had 34 points, eight rebounds, four assists and four blocked shots to lift Philadelphia past host Washington. Pelicans 127, Trail Blazers 110 Trey Murphy III finished with career highs of 41 points and nine 3-pointers as host New Orleans routed Portland. Anfernee Simons scored 17 points and Shaedon Sharpe and Kevin Knox II added 14 each for Portland, which played without leading scorer Damian Lillard (32.1 ppg) because of right calf soreness.Jokic had 35 points, 20 rebounds and 11 assists for his league-leading 27th triple-double of the season but missed a contested 14-foot jumper with 5 seconds left that would have given the Nuggets the lead. Tobias Harris added 11 points and De’Anthony Melton 10 for the 76ers (45-22), who have won five in a row to keep pressure on Milwaukee and Boston for the top two seeds in a crowded Eastern Conference. CHARLOTTE, N.C. — Darius Garland had 28 points, Donovan Mitchell added 23 and Cleveland overcame a 16-point second-half deficit for its fourth win in the last five games. Garland, who sat out Friday night’s loss to Miami with a quad injury, shot 8 of 20 from the field and was 10 of 13 from the foul line, including a free throw with 10.7 seconds left to seal the win. LOS ANGELES — Julius Randle scored 33 points in a bounce-back performance, RJ Barrett got 20 of his 30 in the second half, and New York snapped a three-game losing streak. Immanuel Quickley had 15 points as the Knicks survived a ferocious late rally by the Lakers to salvage a weekend split in Los Angeles without second-leading scorer Jalen Brunson, who has a bruised left foot. Anthony Davis had 17 points and 16 rebounds, but the Lakers fell behind during an erratic shooting performance by three starters: Malik Beasley, Troy Brown Jr. and Jarred Vanderbilt were a combined 5 for 23, missing 14 of their 16 3-point attempts Oklahoma City tied Utah for 10th place in the West at 33-35, but the Thunder hold the tiebreaker after winning the season series 2-1.

Begin story:

RJ Barrett Leads Knicks to Victory Against Lakers, Snapping Three-Game Losing Streak

In a thrilling matchup, RJ Barrett and the New York Knicks claimed victory against the Los Angeles Lakers on Sunday night, halting their three-game losing stream with a final score of 112-108. 

Playing the role of the closer, Barrett scored 13 of his 30 points in the fourth quarter, ultimately securing the win for the Knicks. While Julius Randle led the team with 33 points, Barrett's final bucket with 2:34 left in the game sealed the deal for New York. 

Despite Lakers' D'Angelo Russell scoring 33 points and making six 3-pointers, it wasn't enough to stop the Knicks. The Lakers missed an opportunity to reach .500 for the first time this season, and saw their own three-game winning streak come to an end. 

Meanwhile, in other NBA action, Darius Garland returned to the Cavaliers, scoring 28 points and helping his team put together a strong fourth quarter to defeat host Charlotte. Joel Embiid had an impressive 34 points for the 76ers, lifting Philadelphia past host Washington with a final score of 112-93. 

Over in Portland, the Trail Blazers played without leading scorer Damian Lillard due to calf soreness, and ultimately fell to a crushing 127-110 loss against the Pelicans. 

In Denver, Nikola Jokic had a league-leading 27th triple-double of the season, scoring 35 points, 20 rebounds, and 11 assists, but unfortunately missed a contested 14-foot jumper with just five seconds left in the game that could have given the Nuggets the win. 

Despite numerous exciting games, it was RJ Barrett and the Knicks who captured the attention of the NBA world on Sunday night, with a hard-fought victory against the Lakers.
